meanings.definition: The quality of being deceitful or dishonest in behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her deviousness was evident in the way she always found a way to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent2: The detective was impressed by the criminal's deviousness in planning the robbery.
meanings.sent3: Despite his deviousness, he couldn't fool his best friend with his elaborate prank.
meanings.sent4: The deviousness of the fox in outsmarting the other animals was legendary in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The deviousness of the villain made him a formidable opponent for the hero.

meanings.definition: A devious or cunning action or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The politician's deviousness in manipulating the facts was exposed during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The cat's deviousness in sneaking up on the bird was a testament to its hunting skills.
meanings.sent3: The deviousness of the raccoon in stealing the picnic basket amused the campers.
meanings.sent4: The deviousness of the maze's design challenged even the most experienced puzzle solvers.
meanings.sent5: His deviousness in coming up with creative solutions to problems set him apart from his peers.
